answers.answer: Go to your GP, explain the problem to him and he will be able to refer you to who ever you need to see.

does your husband suffer from diabetes or any nuerological disorders?  I once dated a man that could not ejaculate due to nerve damage from type 1 diabetes.  He began seeing a urologist initially.  Also as odd as it sounds, taking benadryl regularly can actually increase chances of ejaculation.
my husband has the same problem, he has diabetes type 2 and nerve damage, and he "finish" but he does not ejaculate,and when he does its like a drop. its there anything we can do?

question: My husband does not ejaculate during intercourse and it is therefore not possible for him to make me pregnant.  What kind of doctor do we need to see?  We don't have money for those expensive fertility treatments.
title: Anejaculation
